cluster_relations.rel_desc: The young couple hears the news report.

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: in the secluded area, inside the car

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fear of the unknown is an emotion experienced by the young couple in the legend.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Urban Legend Emotional Themes and Responses

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: in the secluded area / car setting
qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: implicit, not named as ‘the couple’s fear’

remarks: The text generalizes to urban legends; mapping specifically to the couple is slightly interpretive.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The young couple perceives a persistent threat of danger.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Urban Legend Emotional Themes and Responses

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: during the unfolding of the story

remarks: Slight inference from general theme to specific characters.

args.canonical_rel_desc: An experiencer (person or group) undergoes or perceives a stimulus, event, or information.
args.justification: In this instance the subject is the experiencer (young couple) and the object is the stimulus (news report), so a directional predicate from experiencer to experienced stimulus is appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A stimulus, condition, or abstract state (e.g., fear, threat) is mentally or emotionally experienced or perceived by an agent.
args.justification: In both instances the subject is the experienced state or stimulus (fear of the unknown, threat of danger) and the object is the experiencer (young couple), so a consistent inverse-style predicate from stimulus/state to experiencer fits both cases.
All three relations describe mental or emotional perception/experience links between an agent (young couple) and an experienced stimulus or state (news report, fear, threat).
The broad semantic dimension is perception/experience of information, emotions, or threats by an agent, which fits a PERCEPTION-style group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: An experiencer (person or group) undergoes or perceives a stimulus, event, or information.
executed_decisions.justification: In this instance the subject is the experiencer (young couple) and the object is the stimulus (news report), so a directional predicate from experiencer to experienced stimulus is appropriate.

executed_decisions.justification: In both instances the subject is the experienced state or stimulus (fear of the unknown, threat of danger) and the object is the experiencer (young couple), so a consistent inverse-style predicate from stimulus/state to experiencer fits both cases.
All three relations describe mental or emotional perception/experience links between an agent (young couple) and an experienced stimulus or state (news report, fear, threat).
The broad semantic dimension is perception/experience of information, emotions, or threats by an agent, which fits a PERCEPTION-style group.
